reviews.review: A very fun game by itself, but it's not the best for those prone to gamer rage- It can be VERY frustrating at times, especially with rude players. Some days it feels like the entire playerbase is comprised solely of assholes, but other days it's great fun! The base killers can get old quickly, so I recommend also buying your favorite Chapter.

DBD is a cool game to play with friends or alone, whether you wish to torment the killer or punish survivors for pallet camping I'm sure you'll have fun. initially playing either survivor or killer seems to have a learning curve with some exceptions being David king and trapper but if you tackle it with a positive attitude I'm sure you'll love it. P.S my favourite killer is myers
very fun lots of strategy involved and excellent detail in the killers

The game is cool and interesting Yes, I only have 100 hours But but i would recommend  every time some new characters come out on a very interesting

Fun game that takes a while to master but it's ton of fun if you mastered it or at least got decent with it
The only thing I would criticize at the moment is that we're still waiting for cross progression on console 
but other than that it's still a great game that is totally worth the 20 Dollars for me

As a streamer, DBD has easily become a game that is enjoyable to play by yourself, and with your community! I love anything horror related and the aesthetics of the game deff keep up with that. The strategy components to it as well help keep my interest, and being able to play with friends and the laughs that come with it, is dope. I like to complete the in game challenges and there is always something to grind out in this game.

There are only two reasons to buy this game:
- You know people for playing Survive With Friends
- You hate yourself to play Killer or Solo Queue Survivor

That is due to two major core problems ruining the game for many players, though there are many others that I will not mention here.

- Even after years, there are still no measures to balance solo queue with 'survive with friends' (SWF) gameplay. As a coordinated SWF is far more effective than four randoms, that unbalance furthermore leads to the problem of impossible balancing between survivors and killer. On the same skill level (and above low MMR) the gameplay is roughly balanced between solo queue and killer, but other aspects like map design (hardly any killer sided maps) or perks (loads of second chance perks) tend to push that scale towards the survivors.

- Yet there is one way for the killer to tip it the other side again: camping and tunneling. Camping a hook to prevent an unhook or going for an unhooked survivor is the best way to get rid of one survivor and have an easier match. However, from a game design perspective, it is unfathomable these techniques are still in game. And it is without a doubt bad game design when the survivor's game experience consists of hanging on a hook without much chance of being rescued/protected because saving/protecting against a camping/tunneling killer takes some coordination that is harder to manage in solo queue.

The only reason why camping and tunneling are still in game though is because they are the only ways of balancing killer vs. SWF. On the same skill level and MMR (and without playing one of the few op killers) there would need to be trolling or some heavy misplays on the SWF's side for the killer to even stand a chance. Camping and tunneling give you that chance, but even with them, SWFs are still in comfortable advantage as they are usually able to prevent both. 

In conclusion: To give killers some chance against SWFs the game offers bad game design mechanics that are naturally used against solo queue survivors more effectively and are thus ruining their game while still being quite ineffective vs. well coordinated SWFs. So you either play killer and while getting better and thus climbing in MMR will face more SWFs who have so much of an advantage that they will ruin your day with troll/toxic gameplay, or you play solo queue where you will be frequently camped and tunneled giving you an absolutely awful game experience.

Or you take the easy and most fun road and play with your friends.

Very unique game style. Beautiful design and graphics. More than that, it is a multiplayer game beyond just indulging in a survival thrill, it explores lives of each character. There is a depth in their suffering, and a will to fight. Interesting game to enjoy with others.

This game used to be the most fun activity to do when you wanted to just have a good gaming experience with your boys. Now, it is misery. The fun has been completely sucked out of the game, mainly if you play as survivor, killer is still fun, but survivor might as well be removed from the game. I would just not buy this game if I were you, please take my advise, this game ain't worth the money like it used to be.
Fun, balanced game both in publics and in customs. Matchmaking is a little wack, but it is still very fun!

The game is good especially if your teammates know what they are doing. It is also fun to chase/being chased. Though most of the players are good, some of the players are just so toxic that they call you names in the post-game chat. I really like to make fun of them coz why not? they need to sometimes taste their own medicine. Overall the characters both survivors and the killers perks are well balanced now. I hope they add more DLC characters in the game.

Bad

I downloaded this game not once, not twice but 3 times. First 2 times I couldn't understand the hype because I didn't give myself long enough to actually learn it. The third time I had the right friends to play it with as they had experience and  were able to get me through the basics, and then that was it, I was hooked, and now it's pretty much my main go to every day, I cannot get enough! The gameplay might not be super strategic on first look but actually there is alot of mechanics to make the gameplay more enjoyable and with the right teammates (and killer) you can have some amazing games! Overall I give it an 8/10 because its kept me hooked for hours and hours everyday.

the point system in this game is awful. You think if a killer is AFK its an easy win? Not a ucking chance, you will be dropped down by a point. Killers tunneling? -1 point. Bad teammates? -1 point. For new players like me, AND solo players it is impossible to climb even 3 rainbow. I think this system needs a major rework, the same with MMR system. Just why separate both? Even on best rank rainbow 1 there is bots and players with 0 skill. You need to understand that if player reaches 1 rank, he put some effort in it and its unfair to put them with beginners. Surv main

Llevo juando a este juego desde hace un par de aÃ±os ya y la verdad eh gastado plata en el y fue en su momento de mis juegos favoritos, pero eh decidido dejarlo por mi estabilidad mental lol, ultimamente con algunos cambios y actualizaciones que han metido, muchos main killers que son la escencia del juego han decidido salirse por que pareciera que  aveces el juego esta hecho para beneficiar a los survivors, pero mas que eso es por la toxicidad de los survivors, por algo aveces tardas muchisimo en encontrar partida, y por si fuera poco aveces por temporadas solo me toca jugar con/contra puros hackers, lo cual obviamente al principio es divertido hasta que te tocan 4 en una sola tarde de juego, y por si fuera poco, los baneos injustificados , a varios amigos les ha pasado que los banean del juego y luego se disculpan los de BH por que en realidad no saben ni a quien eliminan,  Bejeivior arregla tu juego.

Dbd is a lot of fun. You can play with your friends or on your own as Survivor and repair stuff or as killer and kill stuff. 
The queue time varies from time to time, you can get pretty fast in a round or wait super long. 
Sure, there are things that could be worked on. 
Like, if you get camped and tunnelled over and over again its frustrating but in the end the fun overlaps.
10/10, been obsessed with it since February.
